body_html:
Thanks a lot for replying!

  1. Was resolved after following your instructions.
  2. Turns out the VS installer with default settings doesn't install the compiler; So I needed to:
  • install the actual VC compiler from the VS IDE
  • install the 14.11 toolkit (default is 14.13) from the VS IDE
  • change 'Enterprise' for 'Community' in the path in the instructions

Then the batch script completed without issues.

I installed CUDA 9.0 and cuDNN 7 (is CUDA 9.1 or 9.2 supported btw?), and tried running
python setup.py install

That got off to a good start but then got stuck at

c:\program files\nvidia gpu computing toolkit\cuda\v9.0\include\crt/host_config.h(133): fatal error C1189: #error:  --
unsupported Microsoft Visual Studio version! Only the versions 2012, 2013, 2015 and 2017 are supported! [C:\Users\egork
\Dropbox\GitHub\pytorch\aten\build\src\ATen\ATen.vcxproj]

I then looked at host_config.h from the message above, and edited line 131 to read
#if _MSC_VER < 1600 || _MSC_VER > 1913 instead of 1911

And then it compiled successfully overnight.

Turns out the VS installer with default settings doesn't install the compiler; So I needed to:


install the actual VC compiler from the VS IDE

change 'Enterprise' for 'Community' in the path in the instructions

Then the batch script completed without issues.
I installed CUDA 9.0 and cuDNN 7 (is CUDA 9.1 or 9.2 supported btw?), and tried running

That got off to a good start but then got stuck at

I then looked at host_config.h from the message above, and edited line 131 to read

And then it compiled successfully overnight.
body:
Thanks a lot for replying!
1. Was resolved after following your instructions.
2.  Turns out the VS installer with default settings doesn't install the compiler; So I needed to:
* install the actual VC compiler from the VS IDE
* install the 14.11 toolkit (default is 14.13) from the VS IDE
* change 'Enterprise' for 'Community' in the path in the instructions

Then the batch script completed without issues.

I installed CUDA 9.0 and cuDNN 7 (is CUDA 9.1 or 9.2 supported btw?), and tried running 
`python setup.py install`

That got off to a good start but then got stuck at 
```
c:\program files\nvidia gpu computing toolkit\cuda\v9.0\include\crt/host_config.h(133): fatal error C1189: #error:  --
unsupported Microsoft Visual Studio version! Only the versions 2012, 2013, 2015 and 2017 are supported! [C:\Users\egork
\Dropbox\GitHub\pytorch\aten\build\src\ATen\ATen.vcxproj]
```
I then looked at host_config.h from the message above, and edited line 131 to read
`#if _MSC_VER < 1600 || _MSC_VER > 1913` instead of 1911

And then it compiled successfully overnight.
